Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Ba bird
Description: The bird is perched on a rectangular base. The human head is covered by a blue tripartite striated wig with a red sun disc on top. A collar was painted on the chest between the front lappets of the wig. The feathers are painted red, the tail feathers blue. The typical leg feathers of a falcon are realistically modelled. Wooden Ba birds were used as decoration for furniture, standards, stelae or shrines.
